child.geography: A large-population language spoken in the south of Bandiagara plateau (e.g. Diangassagou), on the southern cliffs (e.g. Segue), and in the sandy plains east of the cliffs (e.g. Diallassagou).
child.publications: Heath, Jeffrey. 2012. Dogon and Bangime Linguistics. http://dogonlanguages.org/. (20 September, 2012.)
